meaningMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well. You'll see this used to mean <vocabulary>pipe</vocabulary> more often than <vocabulary>cylinder</vocabulary>, though.
readingMnemonic: Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you to remember: When it comes to <vocabulary>pipe</vocabulary>s, you always want to have two sets of two of them, just in case. So, that's a <reading>two two</reading> (つつ) set of pipes, lined up next to each other for backup.
